channel.title: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show
channel.description:
Hey guys!
I'm Joe 'Fr0z3nR' Radak, Multiplayer Level designer for Black Mesa. Launch has been totally wicked, and thats all because of you guys, so thank you so much. Some of you have noticed that since launch we've been really open and active across community fronts: this forum, reddit, steam forums, ingame, facepunch and more. This is something that we at Crowbar have wanted to do for a while: be more active within the community and break that iron veil we had during pre-steam development. We have a lot more community events planned for the future but, I'm happy to announce one of our recurring events now, [i]The Test Chamber.[/i]
[b]What is [i]The Test Chamber[/i]?[/b] [i]The Test Chamber [/i]is a regular livestream that I will be hosting every-other week. For each episode, the first half of the stream will have either community mod spotlights or artwork, chats about development updates, preview of content patches, and more. Whatever remaining time we have, myself and whoever else is on the stream will pop onto a server where you can come play some MP with us ... if you can find the server we're on! (MUH HAAA MUUHHA HA HA [b]cough cough[/b]). That can also run as a pseudo Q&A session for whatever topic we were talking about during the stream. What do I need from you? Suggestions, ideas, topics! Do you think this format works? We want the communities feedback on this stream.
[i][b]To review:[/b][/i] A livestream show, every-other-week. Time/Day to be determined. Hour long. First half is topic of the week, second half is community MP play Community Mod Spotlights or/and Artwork, Development updates, content patch previews, and more.
So this is our current plan. We'd like to start doing this in the next week or so, once we get a good idea of this is a format ya'll will like. Let us know in this thread.
EDIT: The stream will happen at our official twitch channel, [url='https://www.twitch.tv/blackmesagame']twitch.tv/blackmesagame[/url]

item.title: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show
item.dc:creator: Fr0z3n
item.description:
fury:

Hi. When can we expect the next BM Dev Stream?

I don’t know. Ontop of the stuff I’m doing with Black Mesa, I have a couple other major projects (unrelated to Black Mesa) that I’m working on. One I’m even planning to release come this April. So, honestly, I’m not sure.

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show
item.dc:creator: Swaggless
item.description:
Fr0z3n:

Also, the Rocket League VoD will be delayed a dash. For full disclosure: It’s because I’m debating whether or not I want to make these types of streams (where we play a non black mesa game) part of The Test chamber, or make its own series… which we’d do roughly once a month, maybe twice if there’s a fun holiday or something. If I choose to make it a seperate series, then I’ll need to come up with a witty name for the series.

…“Gordon Freeplay”?

I’d say, as someone who really enjoys the Test Chamber streams, that I’d think the non-BM-oriented content would be better off as a different show. You could still use the same Twitch account for the actual streaming, but just make it notably separate in it’s branding and do the VoD on a separate YouTube channel. I recommend this because I’d think the average person who follows the project (but doesn’t do so religiously), and maybe doesn’t subscribe to the channel may be confused to check it out one day and see let’s plays of a bunch of different games.

Read full topic
item.source: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show

item.title: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show
item.dc:creator: Fr0z3n
item.description:
Joe chief:

So the dev walkthrough is basically your way of replacing ingame comentaries? And will they also be streamed? Cause it didn’t seem like it was when I was watching it.
On another note, if you guys increased the frequency of your streams would that hinder the game’s progress?

Nah, it wouldn’t. I’m the only one who organizes and manages the streams and nothing I’m currently working on will be hindered by increased streaming.

TextFAMGUY1:

Yeah, I’m sure a few devs streaming for an hour or two every week would really hurt the game’s progress. Especially as we’re all machines who want to do nothing but work on BMS for literally all of our spare time.

I am joking (tongue firmly in cheek) by the way, in case that came across harshly.

Wait, you’re not a machine? I have so many questions now.

Also, the Rocket League VoD will be delayed a dash. For full disclosure: It’s because I’m debating whether or not I want to make these types of streams (where we play a non black mesa game) part of The Test chamber, or make its own series… which we’d do roughly once a month, maybe twice if there’s a fun holiday or something. If I choose to make it a seperate series, then I’ll need to come up with a witty name for the series.

Read full topic
item.source: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show

item.title: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show
item.dc:creator: Fr0z3n
item.description:
fury:

Never played or saw RocketLeague before… Stream was cool.

Personally I’d like to see you Stream Reflex from TurboPixel Studios. It’s a new competetive FPS in alpha stage (costs ~ 10 € on Steam Eearly Access), but it’s very well made and super playable already. Next update the devs want to add Capture the Flag. Maybe it was cool if you streamed Reflex in “1v1” or “atdm” in 2on2 or 3on3 (maybe on map bdm3, dp4, dp5 or thct2style) or Capture The Flag.

Or play some good Half-Life 1 Mod (for example escape from the darkness, halfquake, invasion, uss darkstar, todesangst, wanted, E.T.F., Afraid of Monsters, HL: Tactical Espionage Action or they hunger).

Are you still going to make advanced mapping tutorials? I would like to see a singleplayer mapping tutorial… with some tips how to add cool gimmicks to singleplayer maps and how to make enemies work perfect.

What else I would like to see is a modelling tutorial… Maybe for creating worldmodels in Blender or 3DS Max…
Or a basic tutorial how to create decent looking textures with Photoshop or Gimp.

It’s all ideas that we’ve come up with and we’ll be planning them out. There’s a LOT of content that we can do now for the streams. Debating about making them a weekly thing now.

Read full topic
item.source: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show

item.title: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show

item.description:
Haven’t seen the latest stream of Unforeseen Consequences so not sure if you did this - but I would love to see a bit more mapping commentary eg. how the original areas looked and how they were changed, structural etc.
Can’t wait to see it on YouTube!

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
Please stop ending all of your posts with the equivalent of “please respond”. It’s super grating to read, and it really does nothing but make people way less likely to want to respond to what you’re writing. It’s the same on the Steam forums too. You also don’t need to bold all of your text. We’ll read your replies.

We’re very active on these forums, myself in particular. If someone has a useful response, dev team or otherwise, they’ll post it. We don’t willfully ignore people.

Joe and Jordan talked about Crossfire and the next update. You can already find more information about that stuff in the Crossfire dev blog and in this thread: What Happened to the Updates?

Read full topic
item.source: Introducing The Test Chamber, The Black Mesa Livestream Show
